main event: An observer in Syracuse, New York, reported seeing a bright silver-white object circling and stationary in the sky on October 26, 1966.
interesting points: The object was photographed but the cause of the image could not be positively identified,The observer reported no noise was heard during the sighting,The object appeared at 20Â° above the horizon and moved west, making sharp turns,The sighting lasted for around 2 minutes,The observer had excellent eyesight and didn't see any conventional propulsion.
witness description: A 32-year-old clerk-typist, high school graduate, employed at a local bank for 14 years.
